content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Split markdown document into paragraphs
    paras = split(md, "\n\n")

    # Initialize empty array to store code blocks
    code_blocks = Array{AbstractString}(undef, 0)

    # Iterate through paragraphs
    for para in paras
        # Check if paragraph is a code block
        if match(r"^```julia"i, firstline(para)) === nothing && match(r"^```\n$"i, last(para)) === nothing
            continue
        end

        # Extract code block from paragraph
        code_block = extract_code_block(para)

        # Check if it's Julia code
        if !isempty(code_block) && occursin(r"^julia\n", firstline(code_block))
            push!(code_blocks, join(code_block, "\n"))
        end
    end

    # Join extracted code blocks together
    return join(code_blocks, "\n")
end

function extract_code_block(para::AbstractString)
    # Initialize empty array to store code block lines
    lines = Array{AbstractString}(undef, 0)

    # Iterate through lines in paragraph
    for line in para
        if match(r"^```"i, line) === nothing && match(r"^\n$"i, line) === nothing
            push!(lines, line)
        elseif isempty(lines)
            break
        end
    end

    return lines
